meanings.definition: The state of being empty or vacant.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with emptinesses after the furniture was removed.
meanings.sent2: The emptinesses in the jar made it easy to see through.
meanings.sent3: The clown's trick involved pulling endless scarves out of the hat, creating a comical display of emptinesses.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a vast desert of emptinesses, devoid of any warmth or joy.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house echoed with the haunting emptinesses of its past inhabitants.

meanings.definition: The quality of lacking substance or significance.
meanings.sent1: The speech was full of emptinesses, with no real meaning behind the words.
meanings.sent2: His promises were just empty emptinesses, never to be fulfilled.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked delicious, but biting into it revealed only layers of sugary emptinesses.
meanings.sent4: The painting appeared beautiful from afar, but up close, it was just a canvas of artistic emptinesses.
meanings.sent5: The book left a lasting impact on the reader, with its exploration of the emotional emptinesses within the characters.
